review: Service varies from visit to visit. Depending on the crowd and how many workers they have on hand it could take some time to get your order in. Most nights can be full or empty.

I visited this place on a Friday night, and was seated right away.  If I didn't have my kids with my I would have sat in the bar as it was lively.  This place is right off the 10 Freeway and does not have a large crowd gathering which made the waiters available  for quicker service.

stay away from this place is if you are looking to eat.  our waitress never came by to get our order after 20 mins or so then she finally came by to take our order and right now we are still waiting for our food as i m writing this total wait so far 50 mins.  n we are not the only one complaining 2 tables to the left of us complain that their desert is taking forever they had to complain to. the manager to finally get their deserts. For the wait the manager gave us our sons kids meal for free.
Friday night - service sucked, the food was dry and cold.  The restaurant cleared once the computers went down.  Not such a good TGIF night.  Not going back for drive through quality food.

What a disappointment... I was really looking forward to date night with my husband.  Started out good, waitress was doing great.  I ordered the Sirloin steak and asked for the JD sauce on it.  Had to pay an extra $0.59 for JD sauce on my steak.  When it arrived, I could barely shew through my steak.  It was so tough.   Husband hates sending food back but once he took a bite he knew there was no way I could eat it.  I told the waitress, who apologized, and asked if she can get me a beer while I wait for the replacement steak.  Thinking it was going to be on the house, I said yes.  Turned out she charged me for that too.  Well the beer didn't show up for almost 15 minutes and then it was finally followed by the replacement steak 2 minutes later (JD Sauce ont he side now, not grilled on it).  By then, I had finished my sides while waiting and then had to eat the steak by itself. I don't understand what took the second steak so long to come out or why a manager never approached us about the issue.  It was a Wednesday and not busy at all.  I have been here many times and this is the first time I have been this disappointed in this place. Not sure if I will visit this location again, or any other Fridays.
Everytime I visit TGI Fridays the customer service is excellent n the food is just as well. Keep up the great work

Do not go there if you're in a large group of 25 people.  TGIF's was selected as a place to have a company lunch in the beginning of May 2012.  I had made reservations a week prior to my groups arrival. The person (manager?) didn't seem to be familiar with the reservation process. Nor did it seem like they really had one. I told the person my group and I would be arriving at noon for lunch. She said there shouldn't be a problem with seating although sounded unsure or skeptical.  Prior to arriving I called again to make sure that my reservation was confirmed and TGIF said ok.  When my group and I arrived, we had to stand and wait at the door for approximately 20 minutes as the employess shifted the tables around.  I even saw them ask a group of people to move because they needed that table.  You would think they would have thought this out in the beginning. But no such luck.  We were finally seated at 12:25 pm.  There was only one waitress to take the order from my group.  Again poor planning on TGIF's part.  The waitress did a great job though getting our orders down. But it nearly took 15 minutes just to get our drink order in, and another 5 minutes to receive our drinks.  After we recieved our drinks the waitress walked down the line to take everybody's order.  Food eventaully trickled out around 1:30 pm. The quality of the food was decent, but definitely not worth the 1-1/2 hour wait.    You would think that because of the large group and the profits they'd receive (along with the mandatory 18% gratuity for large groups) that their service would be much better. But it was extremely lackluster.  Never again will I ever go back to this place for a company lunch.  They're too inefficient and slow.  Go elsewhere to Bostons or Chinese food.
Jack daniels bacon burger!!! Bombski!  Washed it down with a nice size 3 dollar draft beer... Good food decent prices nice atmosphere!

Great place for lunch and happy hour!!  I work right accross the street. The bar is a little small, but I like it. Great service in the bar. She is always friendly!! My new favorites are the pretzels and Korean steak tacos.

I came here once with a group of classmates for lunch. Service was not so great and our food took FOREVER to arrive. The quality of the food was about the same as any TGI Fridays and I typically like their lunch items but because the service was so questionable, I won't likely be returning here.

I would not recommend it here. - It smells odd inside ( old, muggy, not clean) - Twice my utensils had food crusted on them - When my entrée arrived, I had politely asked two different waitresses about the mashed potatoes that were suppose to come with the steak (odd they would serve a small steak and a side of veggies on a large plate with a gaping spot where the mashed potatoes were suppose to go). The mashed potatoes did arrive and I did appreciate the fact they were honest that the cook had admitted he had forgotten. We're human, stuff happens. Overall I wouldn't visit this place again for dinner nor happy hour.

This place was absolutely horrible!!! The wait to sit down was long. People that came after us were being seated before us. The server took forever to bring our appetizer. Our $30 steak was just fat and when we complained to the server she talk to the manager and the manager didn't even bother to come to out table. Just all around horrible service!

For those of you following along my yelpy journey, you might remember that my beloved Mario G is a TGI Fridays fanatic. I've now been to TGI Fridays all over southern CA, Tijuana Mexico, and London, England. I'm a TGI Fridays aficionado of sorts. I'm not sure that's an accomplishment to brag about, but whatevs. Mario G and I had some business to attend to and we ended up spending a weekend in scenic Ontario, CA. We were staying at a hotel near the Ontario airport, and dining options were pretty limited. Wanting to appease my dining partner and his love of the place, we popped into TGIs and sat at the bar. It was pretty empty for a Saturday around 5pm, but they have a full bar, TVs, and snacks so we decided to stick around. The bartender got our drink order right away and made me a pretty tasty cocktail off of their menu. We ordered our entrees and an appetizer to share and a second round of drinks.  The bartender was happy go lucky, and talked a mean game. I noticed that the bar carried Jack Daniels single barrel and Makers Mark. I was surprised for the location (airport, Ontario, TGIs) that they carried Jack Daniels single barrel.  I noticed that they were pushing Makers based drinks on their menu, so them having makers wasn't a total shocker.  I decided to order one of my favorite cocktails.  A Makers Old Fashioned. The bartender stalled and made a witty remark while racking his brain on how to make an old fashioned. He confessed that he had never been asked to make one, but he would give it a shot. He looked up the drink on his handy dandy POS and he started muddling away. He read the instructions again, and shook his head. The instructions said, that he should muddle, and then throw out the cherry and orange. He said that although he had not made an old fashioned before, this just didn't make sense to him. I told him that he was correct and to leave the muddle in there. He took a taste test of the drink and gave it to me for the real test. He actually did really well! The drink was the topic of conversation across the now full bar and our heroic bartender took the time to explain to the customers what an old fashioned tasted like, and what Makers Mark tasted like. A customer sitting next to me at the bar decided to have one as well based on my thumbs up job for the one the bartender had made for me.

do not go in here on a friday or saturday night. horrible service. we checked in and waited for 35 minutes, when we were seated we waited another 25 minutes before anyone even acknowledged us or offered us a drink. then when the next tables waitress walked by we asked for some service and she said "well, you're not my table, but i guess i'll get you some waters.." just very rude and disrespectful. please, don't get me wrong, we enjoy this place on a weekday, the food is great and the service is good.. but last weekend was a little ridiculous and i will never return on a weekend... ever again & it's recommended that you do the same...

If you are in the abyss that is ONT (Ontario International Airport) this is one of the few places close enough to get a bite before a flight. The airport is pathetic (nothing is open - no services, no food, no nothing, not even a coffee shop).  I've only ever sat at the bar here - I despise TGI Fridays menu - but if I'm desperate for something edible post work and pre-flight....this fits the bill. I don't think I've ever paid full price for anything here. It's like an eternal happy hour.  Service is passable.
Two for $20 specials!! You get what you pay for when you come to Friday's so you cant go here expecting to have the best steak or fish of your life. Their appetizers are ok, but not great.

Not even one star for this restaurant. The food tasted horrible and the prices did not match the size of the food. For $12 they gave 2 tablespoons of rice (on the menu it was rissotto, but it was just plain rice) topped with some kind of arteries clogging cheese sauce (which they called alfredo sauce) and 12 small pieces of chicken. Do not think about going there. Drive a little bit more, find a respectable restaurant.

I met the coworkers here for happy hour.  This is your typical TGIF.  Appetizers are 1/2 off during happy hour and there are drink specials.  I got a Guiness beer but I don't remember what the happy hour discount was.  Our waitress was friendly and on top of things.  Drinks came out slowly as the bartenders were backed up. We stayed a bit longer after our check was paid and they didn't try to kick us out.  A good place for happy hour but if single and looking like one of my coworkers this place has more families than single people.

Sunday happy hours are the best.  Been a fan of Fridays since I was allowed in to drink (11 years now!).  It's a staple, you can count on the food tasting great, you can count on the drinks tasting great.  If you can't make up your minds where you want to go, then go here, it will never disappoint.

An eclectic menu with a bar style ambience is how I feel about TGI Fridays.  The selection off the menu has many grlled choices. A lot of burgers, steaks, ribs, etc. I chose a protein style parmesan burger and a salad instead of the fries. The burger was grilled very well and I loved the sauce on the burger. The server thought it was odd that I was ordering a burger protein style and commented no one had ever asked for that from him. Boyfriend had the same burger made as it should be and he said awesome and very filling. The happy hour menu extended throughout the entire restaurant which we thought was pretty cool.  Service was so-so. It took a really long time to get our drinks, and once we ordered appetizers the basket of fries didn't come out till the food did. Getting a glass of wine took awhile  as well. As I looked around the restaurant I noticed the servers were everywhere and nothing seemed too organized so maybe that was a cause for delay.

I thought TGIF is supposed to be a bar...what a poor choice of drinks! Unless my gate was across from the table I'd walked away. Service was slow and again, very little choice of beer was HUGE turn off. I guess the whole point here is order heavy stuff, preferably a shot or two, and leave....and don't come back.

Its been a long time since I have been to a Fridays. Before I have been to the one in the Victoria Gardens and I wasn't that impressed. This Fridays completely changes my mind all together. I don't know if they changed the menu but there was a large selection, and I had a hard time choosing what I would order. I finally decided on the sizzling chicken and shrimp, comes on a hot skillet plate which I love! The food was the best! Ended up getting dessert, the vanilla bean cheesecake, I'm really not a fan of cheesecake but this was decadent and savory. Ordered a long island with different specifications and even though at first they were hesitant, they made it my way just to make me happy! Woo Hoo this Fridays Rocks!
Excellent restroom. Friendly staff. Slightly off the beaten path. Lovely patch of grass to walk barefoot through before getting back on the freeway.
Nicaraguan guy has the hots for my friend and he is very attentive :-)

Bottomless Fries?----I think not... Ordered the burger and bottomless fries and was very disappointed. Burger came out looking nothing like the picture--even the waitress said it did not look like the photo. All you can eat fries---well, if you don't like waiting 15 min. for each order of steak fries and you only get -6-. Waited for 30 min. for 2 refills and life is way too short to waste my time on that. If you want bottomless fries, go to Red Robin. Used to be a fan of TGIF but this has left a bad taste in my mouth. Sorry to say...Won't be back to this place.

I came here with my friend on an afternoon and was actually shocked to find that there were quite a number of people dining even in the mid-afternoons.  Food was okay, the steak, although I requested a "medium" steak, came out tough and more "medium well" than medium. Fridays always does well with their sides, no complaint on there. That was all that me and my friend ordered, their steaks. Should have had something a lot more adventurous, but maybe for next time. Service was superb, I think most Friday's employees are trained for their customer service.

Price: Low  to Med Pricey ($10 and up) Food: Gross to Fair  Service: Mediocre to Good Parking: Plentiful Interior Ambiance: Southern Country Club Saloon Views: Parking lot, Business park Valet?: No We had been to this place one or twice before. It's not big on food quality as most of these restaurants don't seem to be for some reason (sad), but what it is big on is bar and party atmosphere.  This particular TGIFs is located in an unappealing location next to an office business park and the 10 freeway. The problem with the third time as I've stated before in my other reviews as with other restaurants WAS THE GROSS FOOD!.   I ordered jerk chicken. I know what jerk chicken is supposed to taste like and not because I'm black, it's because I've had this dish prepared right (The Cheesecake Factory does a fantastic job with this dish) TGIF just throws some kind of gross tasting jelly that supposed to be spiced like jerk chicken, and it totally ruins the dish. The chicken was tough, it wasn't seasoned or spiced. Throwing jerk chicken jelly on it was a sick insult. Whoever heard of such a thing?  It must be a TGIF invention, because I've never had this dish served in such a gross and insulting fashion as they did. With jerk chicken, the chicken pieces are supposed to be heavily spiced and seasoned with special seasoning, NOT A JELLY! You don't just throw some weird flavored jelly on it and call it jerk chicken. Sick.. What is wrong with these places that can't even prepare food properly? I have never been back since, and neither have the three friends I went with after that scenario. They tasted my dish and couldn't believe the insulting way it was prepared. I forgot what they ordered, but they weren't particularly pleased with their meals either.
Our food was cold and taste like it was frozen. The Victoria Gardens location is much better!

Worst meal I think i've ever had. Potato skins had to be at least 2 days old. Cobb salad consisted of lettuce cores couple cherry tomatoes and stale bacon. My husband had the pulled pork sandwich it was ok but very little meat. $30.00 wasted.

Stopped by here for dinner before a concert since it was literally the only thing around. They quoted a 30 minute wait but we got sat in about 5 (2 of us).  We got the 2 entree for $20 meal. I paid a couple bucks more for the Jack Daniel's chicken, which I think was worth it since I was in the mood. Can't beat this deal. We got the fried green beans to start (part of the deal). Not bad. My friend got the chicken pasta and didn't eat the chicken - not that the chicken was bad, she just likes having it there as a garnish.  She ordered another shot for her mixed drink since it was super weak. Though most chain restaurants tend to skimp on the booze so I wasn't surprised. That's why I just went with the beer.  It was pretty busy on this particular Friday night despite being in the middle of nowhere, so service was a tad slow but we got out when we needed to. Though to be honest, part of my memory of this visit is a bit hazy due to my pre-visit appetizer.

Waited ten minutes to get a drink after being seated for 20 mjnutes. Food is always excellent . Waiter was pleasant but a little slow . Ordered popular commercial on TV about $10 app and entree. He pulled out a wrinkling piece of white paper with menu items???? Come on Fridays... U can do better then that. My waiter also charged me full price for the $10 special. 3 times he gave me the check until it was correct.

Just left and we got the worst service ever. The waitress took our order for drinks and 15mins later we had to go look for her to remind her of our drinks she was just forgetful and slow. The worst service by far. And their kids pizza taste like frozen pizza that cooked in a microwave. Gross!!!!......i will never go back to this location it wasnt happy hour and it wasnt a busy night to say they were very busy the waitresses were standing around gossiping. Wth!!!!.....but the waitress made sure she was back in a heart beat to check on her tip. Here is my tip: Get to work stay focused and remember you want a good tip provide good service.

Picked up a to go order and when I got home I noticed something wrong with my Cajun Shrimp & Chicken pasta......My food was not fresh nor hot...I guess the restaurant  either ran out of fettuccine noodles or he was rushing.....I opened up my food to find out that the mixed linguini and fettuccine noodles together.....My pasta was very dry and had no flavor whats so ever.....I WILL KOT B RETURNING to this location...

Love this place the management should be happy to have good servers.. I believe I had a server named Olivia (I think) and another helping out (Bri I believe ) anyways went for happy hour and was there for hours because of the good ambience. Not to crowded and my table had a blast will definitely go back.. Get both those servers if anyone goes
Average TGIF experience and food.  They have tons of seating!

When you eat at a restaurant like this i definitely don't expect 5 star service, but this location has the worst service ever! First we ordered an appetizer to start with and they brought us the appetizer with no utensils and no plates, WTH do they expect me to do eat it with my hands and wipe my fingers on my clothing. NO COMMON SENSE. Get it together staff!!!

well my husband and i had been talking about going here for awhile when we arrived there was no one to greet us my husband finally walked to the booth They er y seated us took awhile to come to our table the girl asked if we wanted our drinks my husband and i ordered strawberry lemonade and my daughter ordered a coke it took forever for them to bring it to us so the waitress comes i ordered pasta my husband ordered a phillysteak hamburger with fries and my daughter ordered salmon and steak dinner which comes with two side orders she ordered fries and jasmine rice. it took forever well when the finally brought us our dinner mine was correct my daughters side orders were wrong they brought her a baked potato instead of rice we didn't say anything. They gave my husband his hamburger and fries we started eating food is good. No complaints then my husband notices a hair in his fries i was are you serious i looked and there was he didn't want me to say anything but i ask to speak to the manager she came over and i should the hair she was very nice apologized and she said she would get him another order of fries well when she returned she gave him his fries she gave back with another plate for my daughter saying they had given her the wrong order they did let us keep the extra plate of food but i did expect better service from this place we finished our food and the manager gave us discount but i will never go back again anybody who goes to TGIF check your food for hairs or at least this one

Just finished up dinner and it was actually pretty good. Happy Hour all day Sunday is always nice to see. I ordered 2 orders of chicken wings and the potato skins. Mild and Garlic were the flavors that I chose and both were very tasty. The potato skins were covered in bacon and cheese... two things I highly enjoy on top of my food. Oh! And I ordered one of their new drinks. Pirate Peach or whatever. Extremely delicious and very strong. Had a nice head change off of just one.

Food was OK but service was terrible. It wasn't that busy but the waitress was SLOW. Drinks took 15 min to arrive after our order, the salad another 15 min and our meal was 20 min more. We had a coupon for buy one get one free and the waitress give us the correct credit. POOR Service!!!
This is my favorite place for happy hour they have a good selection and i love that i can use my give me stripes rewards to get discounts and even free food.

Just the worst I'm really not a picky person but you wait 5 minutes to get seated how can you not get mad. We were the only ones waiting and the place was not fully 6 tables max with people sitting down. Then the food, my fries where very cold compared to my nephew's fries . Don't get your kids the cheese burger tastes like plastic and the bread is bigger then the meat. My mother "1st time there" did not like it, she said she has never had such hard chicken in her like. For service you're better off going to the in Victoria gardens. But the food does suck for the price they ask for!
This place had been good to me for years. The people take care of you and the food is really good. The bartenders have always been very friendly and up to speed with orders

Came here for lunch on a friday around 2pm there was no wait. Waitress was nice and courteous. My bf and I ordered a sandwich and soup special and took them almost a whole hr to make. The restaurant was practically empty and they couldnt think of any good excuse of why it was taking long. We asked and they said that the turkey in our sandwich were on the grill. When we got our sandwich our turkey was not grilled...anyways slow service for an empty restaurant. Two stars goes to the waitress

This place is a hit or miss the food is great so we keep coming back but the service lacks and the bar area is either okay or they completely sick but my husband loves the ribs and the steaks are good

The food was the saving grace of this experience. Our server was extremely impersonal and incredibly slow. We ordered our appetizer and dinner within 5 minutes of sitting down. It took 30 minutes for our food to come out. Our server (who never said her name) never came to the table to see how we were doing until we had finished. We ordered dessert and at that time I asked for a box. The dessert came out and still no box. I asked a second time when the check came but again waited until after we had paid.  On a side notes, the women's restroom was atrocious. There was toilet paper and paper towels all over the floor. The mirror had hand prints all over it and there was water all over the counter.  I would come back but pray to be in another's servers section and not use the restroom.

They "wow" me tonight... It's like clock-work. Ryan's service was phenomenal. Table was clean, greeted with a smile, and we got our drinks right away.  Our appetizer was warm and tasted fresh. Right after, the main meal came. Then, drinks were refilled.  I felt pampered... "Awwwww". Awesome nite paired with spur's winning game 1.

This franchise cannot get it right and Im finished trying. Untrained servers, less-than-fast food quality food that is expensive. Many chains have lost It. But TGI is down there with Red Robin. Disgusting burgers, overcooked parm fries. This is giving them Four chances. I used comp coupons from corporate to go back. Same. No change. Just like Red Robin, Carinos, these corporations apparently do not care about quality or may be like WaltonMart and the Titanic, too big to fail?

This place wasn't crowded, which I loved. However what I didn't like is that the waitress would rather chit chat with coworkers instead of bringing me my water with lemon or food. She eventually brought my water...w/out lemon! I reminded her and finally I got my darn lemon. I was ready to order but my waitress was MIA!! What's really going on?!? The place was practically empty what else did she have to do besides doing her job. She finally came I placed my order....and poof she's off again. Someone else brought the food. They didn't asked if there was anything else I needed, or if I wanted a drink other than water. I ate my food and left, I still left a tip because I'm not wack like my waitress and the service I received.

I walked out, manager seated me, then nothing, place was empty empty, so seems move was to blame. I was hungry, prepared to buy drinks and large meal so to have some Togo.  I WAS IGNORED, SO I WALKED OUT. other locations are much better.
This place should be torn down a rebuilt . Tables are sticky and every thing else is  old and or broken down.
Service OK food is not as advertised. Three layer Ruben looked like someone stepped on it. Bread soggy comped 5 bucks. Last time we will be here.
Food was good. Service was not! & the wait to get our orders of endless apps took too long! No apologies we just had to wait it out
One star because the food was cold, their customer service sucked , and the place smell bad.

Just left this Friday 's food was ok. Had the endless appetizers with friends. Wings were good mozzarella sticks were good but they brought me old potato skins. When they brought me out the new order of potato skins they were much better. Service was okay but when I called the manager over for a dispute with our check. She made the night that much better. Cece was the manager and she was really really nice. More managers need to have the attitude that she had. She saved this restaurant from getting a worse review.
Servers are nice, but unfortunately they work for a manager who lacks the authority to make executive decisions. Don't expect reasonable people here.

I like this location. It's decent. My girl and I used to go to the West Covina before we moved to the I.E. Anyways, So far so good. Our first waitress was really pleasant. I don't put people names on here on blast even if I'm giving them their props but will say the food is great and service has been pretty good. I'm not that picky on the food believe it or not as long as it has flavor, not dry, fresh and hot!   I'm very picky on the service though. If I don't like you then guess what? I'm moving to a different table and will get a different server, simply put. Why? because the food won't be as enjoyable if the server and service is not up to par so yeah there's been times where I wasn't feeling the server and got someone else instead but this was at different restaurants. I can tell whether  the first few minutes whether I want you to stay as my waiter/waitress. All I ask is for a smile and if you have a nice personality then that's a plus, check up on us at at east twice, make sure the food is what we ordered and how we ordered, fresh, not dry, tasty and hot. That's pretty much it and I do believe in tipping well. As far as this location goes, the food and service is pretty good. We would come again especially on Sundays since their happy hour is all day I think

I really love this Friday's. It's down the street from my home and the service is ALWAYS wonderful. We've never experienced a long wait. I love their happy hour prices. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and accommodating. They have various vegetarian and seafood options, which I enjoy. We'll be back for sure!

never go here! granted, we had a large party, however he took 45 minutes just to get a glass of water. not even exaggerating! and, you cannot order a drink at the bar if you are seated at a table. No joke! Drinks are so watered down and their shots are sooooo small. we were even told not to be so loud! Come on we were a group of 30.

Joseph, Joanna and Charlie were wonderful.  After some confusion we realize I placed my to go order at the Rancho location but I was at the Ontario location.    They took good care of me they got my order ready for me quickly and Joseph (mgr) gave me my dessert on the house.  Great food & service. :

2nd time here for happy hour.   1st time was a month ago and everything was superb.  This time no so much. Service was not good.  Original waitress didn't card everyone so the second waitress spend 5 minutes discussing the rule..of cause everyone in the group was over 21 so who cared. Then she went on break so no one came near the table for over 20 mins which is unacceptable.   Sadden by this!!! Food and drinks were good but when the bill came we were over charged by $17..never again. ..new place. ..

The sole reasoning behind this visit was because it was on the way back to home base and I wanted to beat the Friday dinner rush. Miguel did a really good job with our drinks & food and he was very polite I'll make no qualms about it. Kudos to him. Dragonfire Salmon hit the spot but try to avoid the spinach dip. Ma Dukes really liked her shrimp & chicken pasta as well. I'll be back.

I loved this TGI they're so friendly. I loved the Waitress she was so sweet. I told her I was getting married and when we finished earring she took me dessert and Congratulated me . My friend and I order  1 dished to split and she even brought it to us separately. I will definitely return to this location

Rib Eye, Ribs, Chix ya fix....I keep it short and sweet!! Long Island Ice Tea for the Lady!!! Happy Hour Half off.  I'm no cheap date but I'm thrifty....you can't go wrong with the menu!! Your date on the other hand is a whole other story

The only reason this place gets 2 stars is because the service staff is professional and attentive.  The food quality is terrible though.  The soup was cold the salad was dry and the soft drink was flat.

do not go here.  takes 10 minutes to be greeted on a slow night!!!! once seated we werent even acknowledged by anyone!  i had to stand up and raise my hand!!! terrible service and terrible wait time!!! dont waste your night!!!

This place was a-okay. I wasn't expecting much because I haven't heard amazing things about this place, but it wasn't entirely disappointing either. My boyfriend loved the steak, but I was a little disappointed with the pasta. I am a very big pasta fan, and this stuff tasted like cheap spaghetti that my 5 year old brother can make. The chicken was grilled, and that was rather savory, but I didn't even have the urge to finish it because the pasta didn't amount. I think desserts anywhere are just delicious because the brownie that they served was YUMMY! Probably won't be back, just needed to use a gift card.
Our waitress Sadie was the best. She treated us like famiky. It was packed tonight but we still received our food quickly & full of flavor.

Came here after finding out about endless appetizers. Turns out the way it works is you have to order the same appetizer over and over again. If you have more than 2 people it's worth it, other than that not worth it. Pot Stickers, bonless buffalo wings and mozzarella sticks were delicious! Loaded potato skins were hot and ready to eat. The time in between orders was only about 3 Min.

Bad service and bad food. Avoid unless there's a wait everywhere else, I would not recommend anyone go here. We went for lunch on a Thursday (group of 6) and it took over an hour to get our food after we first sat down; we all ordered off the lunch menu. Our waitress was nowhere to be found for 15 minutes and when she finally did take our orders, we didn't see her again until after the food came. I got the black bean burger with cilantro lime slaw. The burger was dry and spicy, while the slaw was bland and chewy. The price wasn't bad, coming in at $11 for my meal, but I'd stay away if I were you. As a side note, I left my credit card there and went back to get it later that day (around 5pm). The bartender told the manager that I was there to pick it up, but the manager continued about his business. Finally, I caught his attention myself and he acknowledged that he was really busy and forgot about me. That whole ordeal took 15 minutes. Overall, the place seems very disorganized.

My family and I ordered the $10 endless appetizers and it was good but not as good as the TGIF at Victoria Gardens. The food was okay and the waitress was also nice and got our orders but when we asked for our second round of appetizers it took way longer than the first time and it was around 9 p.m and there was hardly any people there.

Horrible service! The host seated us and came back with one set of utensils. She told us our server will be right with us with another set of utensils if they found an extra one. A waitress came up to us 20 minutes later asking if we've been helped. After we told her no she apologizes to us and says she doesn't know where our waiter is but she'll put in a drink order for us. 20 minutes later.... still no drinks and still haven't put in our food order, the waitress attends to a couple who had just arrived and took their drink and food order.The staff was completely unorganized. Management reallly needs to train staff for better customer service. We will not return to this location.

I have visited this Friday's location quite a few times. The food is good and compares to any other Friday's. However, the service isn't always the best. A few months ago I went with my husband. Although the server was friendly, not a single finished plate or empty glass was cleared from our table during the entire visit. Last time we went with a few friends, we started out with a server named Courtney who was AWESOME. We were just ordering drinks and she informed us of happy hour specials and popular items. She was on top of things and very efficient. However, they weren't very busy that night, so Courtney went home and was replaced by a server named Mike, who was TERRIBLE. We decided to order appetizers, and after we had been waiting quite some time for the food to come, he commented "I should tell the lazy Mexicans in the kitchen to hurry up." He also cursed several times during our visit, making vulgar comments about the staff and others, and mixed up our bills at then end of the night. We haven't been back to this location since then.

I was very disappointed from the get-go. This was my first time going to Monday Night Football. I ordered two beers and it took over 10 minutes. It wasn't busy at all either. I made the mistake of ordering food and that took over 30 minutes. The only thing good about this place is their General Manager Joe was very apologetic about the whole thing and admitted that they were really under-staffed that night.  I porbably wont be going back to this TGI Fridays.

I went in last night for happy hour in the bar section. Happy hour is every night from 10 pm to closing hours. Most appetizers are half off and some drinks are like $6. Believe me, the bartender does not hold back on the liquor. That's a great thing. I managed to drink only two margaritas. My friend and I shared 2 appetizers which were the nachos and the spinach dip. Our server was attentive and constantly checking on us. This is a great place to enjoy good drinks and tasty appetizers.

I've given this place at least 4 different attempts. Each time the service is sad. Everything seems to be an extra charge. Half the soft drinks are non refills and you only find that out after you get your bill.(its happened to a few of my coworkers) the last time we were here the waitress was nowhere to be found half the time. the hostess brought out our food. of course plates were wrong or missing something. she had no clue... why would she she's the hostess!  utensils you ask why would we need those to eat our food?!! my burger was so greasy. I ate half of it because I was starving and well where's the waitress?! plus the food took so long to come out there was no way I was sending it back to wait longer. the best part was when even our split checks were wrong.

We ordered three orders of the ribflight trio and a potato skins appetizer and when were nearly done with our appetizer,  we were informed that they ran out of ribs. We then (after much debate) settled on a replacement order. I somewhat jokingly asked the waitress if she was going to give us a discount or desert, since we were not able to have the ribs. No more than 5 minutes later (after about 45 minutes of us trying to figure out what we want as a replacement)  magically the manager and waitress came with the meals we had originally requested and the manager gave us a fabricated story. We believe that the mysterious arrival of our correct meals was due to our request for compensation and if we had ordered a rib meal that was more expensive to begin with we never would have faced opposition in the first place. I have been bragging to my mother and grandfather about how good TGIF's ribs were and convinced them to try out the place. They were very dissatisfied and to top it off the bottom of my chair was broken. We do not feel the waitress was in any way at fault and feel this whole ordeal is due to poor management, whether because of a lack of ribs being ordered from your supplier or a lie to try avoi good on a promotion that TGIF is obviously running.

Whoever is in line cooking the steaks needs to get a new job or be retrained. My husband and I have ordered pick up here twice, we ask for steak medium rare on two occasions  and both times the steaks come out well done; practically jerky. We were staying here on business and were excited to see a tgif within driving distance. This is such a disappointing experience because we love the Jack Daniels menu. Please consider retraining your staff. By the time we got a manager on the phone to try and reconcile our order our food was all cold and it was 20 minutes until closing, to top it off someone hung up on us or we got disconnected either way we won't be coming back to this location. I am going to McDonald's now instead of eating my 40 dollar meal.

My family and I came in and we're seated right away...that was the only good thing. The service is so poor and y he food is disgusting. They just need r o tear bipolar down and start new or something. It was just beyond bad. Never will come back, would rather starve.
Service is too long. Waitress was nice but hardly around. Dessert brownie tasted like it was bought from the grocery store :( and heated up. Not the best experience

Back in 2006-2010, I used to come here quite a bit and loved the steaks and Jack Daniels grilled items.  It started going downhill in 2011 and I stopped going in 2012.  I recently went back to see if it was back up to standard, but unfortunately it wasn't.  The steaks were overcooked and the service just wasn't cutting it. The place is getting a little dated, so you're better off trying out other restaurants.

Worst service ever! We walk in and let the hostess know we have a party of 5 with 2 kids, she says it'll be 2 minutes. 20 minutes later she calls us and the place was not busy! She also says party of 6,no big deal even though I stated 5. Then we sit and she only brings 1 kids menu as she leaves I ask her for another, to which she replies she'll bring it right back, never saw her again. Waitress comes to take the drink order and she cards my grandma!! Never have we been anywhere that asked an elderly lady for ID, ummm it's quite obvious she's of legal drinking age!  We ask the waitressAlissa for the kids menu. Manager comes by with drinks and we ask her for a kids menu as well because at this point my 7 yr old is in tears over the fact that our 9 year old has an adult menu and he is the only one being treated like a child (uggghh). The manager finally brings it and all this before we even have our food!! Won't be going back , I'd rather drive farther to the one off Haven in Ontario than endure the service here again!!!!

service was super slow for an almost empty monday night and the food wasn't good either..didn't feel like my $60 check was worth it for stale mac 'n cheese and dry ribeye "jack daniels". never going back here again. this is my first and last time. 2 stars for quick greet and seat, though. sorry.

After a relatively long day, we stopped off to grab something to eat and have a drink.  I ordered a Maker's Old Fashioned and it was flawless! Our server Mike is fantastic! He is so attentive to our needs - we ordered a drink we didn't really like and he switched it out immediately. He's funny, entertaining, and fast. He's on it! Ordered the BBQ Chicken flat bread and it was really tasty.  Happy hour - half off appetizers and $4 dollar wells. Not too shabby!

Ate here tonight. .food was ok but the staff and manager harassed our party about whether we had id. the ages of the party are 40 to 74?? won't come here again. Almost forgot to mention, the bathroom was messy and flooded with I don't know what.

Only happy hour are worthy here. I never been to TGI Friday, and this was my first and probably last time here.  The atmosphere are  similar to Apple Bee's.  Their serve traditional All American food here.   Their happy hour is probably the only reason you should come here.  Half off almost all appertizers, $1.50 fries and slider. The regular price of those appetizer are ridiculous.  $11 for wings, which is higher price than wings specially shop. Food here is just not good and isn't fresh, the service here is excellent though despite mediocre food. The location of this TGI is strange, is basically middle of no where except near few business building.  Only way to access here is driving.

Came here to eat with my family. We were seated in good time, but that was about the only good thing that has happened. The waitress was very nice and patient, but slow. Service is slow. Service is slow. I had to say it a few times to make sure you understand. Drinks came out probably 15 minutes after they were ordered. Appetizers came out probably 20 minutes after that. The potato skins are comparable to cheese wiz on a potato, hamburger had burnt buns.. I doubt I'll ever be back.

Me and my wife decided to try this TGIF, for the first time. They were busy, but attentive. Seated in 10 to 15min. Waitress came right away. Menu's were very sticky, so sticky I almost couldn't turn the pages. My wife had to ask for another menu. I like to give any business a chance, so I saw a manager (Jose) and stopped him, how is it possible for the menu's to be so sticky before we can order the food? He apologized, and said they shouldn't be sticky. He went to the front desk and talked to the staff, next they took all the menu's to the back and wiped them all down! He came back and apologized again. And told us thanks for bringing that to his attention, and please let him know of any other problem's. We have to allow the leaders, (Manager's) the opportunity to correct their issues, before we dog them out. Because of Jose's quick reaction to the problem, we will be back!

Pretty much just "okay." Menus were sticky, and the menu layout makes it take three times as long to read (opening all the fold-outs; like items not consistently grouped together) Food was lukewarm or cold for several in our group. Order carefully as it would be easy to put together a meal here with more calories than you need in a week. More healthy options would be an improvement.

First off my party of 4 got seated of waiting a minimal time for a Friday night. We got the happy hour special, and so many endless apps. I then proceeded to eat my weight in endless appetizers... I am so content and amazingly bloated. All I can say is TGI Friday!

Not sure why I've given this place so many chances.  I know it could be worse, but it also could be much better.  The food is okay.  Nothing spectacular, but my expectations are pretty low for a chain restaurant like Fridays.  You've had one meal at a Fridays, or a Dennys, or Chilis, you've had them all.  Personally I think it's a little pricey for what you get, but it's really comparable to their competitors. What amazes me is the poor service.  If it were just once, I'd blame it on a particular server, but this place must give classes on how to stand around and ignore customers.

Manager has issues went to watch basketball game have drinks and even ate I invited family to join and drive me home in case I drank to much , I asked for a last call and waitress said I need to drink water, OK I did she poured another I drank it. Still no issue she poured a third I got upset asked for check...... I'll never come back and I suggest u go to rancho tgif where they take care of u the Lil manager has issues I don't know how he got his position cause he has no customer service they should close that store down

Food and sever is decent. I gave it. 3 and not a 5 because they stuffed the boneless buffalo wings with bread or something instead of all real meat. The meat was kind of dry as well. They take awhile to bring out your food as well, so make sure to order ahead of time if you're going to pick the $12 Endless Appetizer deal.
Always able to get a seat fast and service is usually good. Love happy hour. Also good with their points we have received a number of free meals with the points.

Great service, the waitress I had was very nice. The food was very tasty and was not under cooked. I ordered the strawberry lemonade along with the Jack Daniels burger and fries. The waitress constantly came by to make sure we were okay and to see if we needed anything (something I appreciate), overall the experience was nice the restaurant had a nice atmosphere and was filled with nice people working.
Great service from Cesar tonight. Food came out in a timely manner. Only down side was restrooms were extremely disgusting.
I love this place! Great happy hour, most of the bartenders are awesome. Chris, Ryan and Debra are the ones to see while youre there.

This place is horrible. I gave it one star only because of our server. He was pretty attentive, but other than that, I have nothing good to say. The food was whatever and made me and my husband sick later that night (and we ordered different plates). The bill came out to $70!!! On what I have no idea, but I'm positive we won't ever be eating at a tgi Fridays again!

Great happy hour specials!!!Our server was awesome,fast, and very friendly!!He was even training a new girl no wonder he was great!!My boys enjoyed their steaks and I loved the artichoke dip which was half price for happy hour!! The french onion soup was a little salty but the wedge salad was on point!!We'll be back!!

If you are looking to dance during lunch time then this is the place to go.   They play the most annoying loud music during lunch time.    I think the manager is blind and must not wonder why there are not more business people coming here for lunch.   Come here if you want to eat and have a headache.   The place to go.
Always friendly! Great happy hour!  $12.00 all u can eat appetizers... Way to go!  I don't know how they stay in biz !  But I'm glad they are!

I'm here at Friday's as I type this . Friday's is my every week place to go with my family . Tonight though was the worst service I have ever received even with the restaurant not that busy. Usually we come and order our apps and a couple of drinks and relax and enjoy but today was nothing like that. We called to see how long the wait was for 4 adults and 2 children which the host said there was no wait. We showed up and they said 15 minutes so we waited .. 10 minutes later the host came out and said sorry but it's going to be longer than expected. 35 mins later we get seated. Once seated we ordered our food and drinks . It took 15 min to get a strawberry lemonade. Finally the food came and I was extremely dissatisfied the potatoes skins were burnt . The boneless buffalo wings were super dry plus the majority of them had no chicken it was just batter . Then we still had to wait for plates which we never received and we had to ask for The only thing that was good was the pot stickers. What's going on here ? This is the location I come to all the time. To top it off we talked to a manager and he took off some items due to the poor service we received . We waited 20 mins after the manger brought the check and still no one returned to collect out payment. We got up walked to the host to pay and left . I will never go back

Great time and experience. The food was fast. The drinks were even faster. The waitress Viki was constantly coming over to see if we needed anything. Great customer service. Would go back any day of the week.

Kitchen was very slow.  The endless appetizers are pointless if you don't have 2 hours to sit and wait for your second plate of food.  Getting the first plate took 30 minutes.  The waiter was okay.  My glass was filled repeatedly and overall friendly staff.  I think the kitchen is a big problem.

Friendly service however, my salmon was burnt and tasted gross. They offered me a new one but, really they think I should have to wait a long time again for my plate! The least they could have done was offered me a discount on my plate. Very disappointed in them.
Great happy hour starts up again at 10pm til close. Chris the late night bartender was friendly n quick. Drinks were mixed up just the why I like them.

Went last night for happy hour,Chris was the lone ranger at the bar,he was taking care of everybody though!,kept the ultras flowing and my girls Kettle and cran was excellent, appetizers came quick and were good,potato wedges and wings,cant go wrong,had a good size crowd for a Thursday night, got the check and was pretty pleased.we will be back.

We left after 15 minutes without even an acknowledgment. The staff ignored us completely. I can't comment on the food or the drinks because we didn't get any. When I told the hostess at the front why we were leaving, there was no apology whatsoever. We went to Black Angus instead, and what a huge difference!

This place has gone down hill in a very bad way. My son ordered mac and cheese and when he got it it was frozen my mom ordered the pizza that was burnt. I ordered a margarita had to send it back twice and just told the waitress to forget about it and i will just have water which never got refilled   My son ordered the loaded potatoes and i kid you not they looked like they were made hours before hand. Horrible horrible horrible place to f ing eat. Avoid at all cost. We should have noticed it coming as it was empty on a Saturday

My first experience eating here with my family was not up to my expectations, not only did it take a while to bring us our drinks (water and soda) we sat waiting for 47 minutes exactly for our food. Our waitress didn't check up on us once, she also didn't communicate with us to let us know what's going on with our food. Unfortunately I forgot her name. I can honestly say I am never going there again that was the worst experience. The only reason why I am giving it two Stars is because the restroom was extremely clean.
If you like dry and stale food and waiting 45 minutes for appetizers this is the place to be. This place has gone down hill and it used to be one of my favorite spots in college.

Came here for the endless appetizers. Took us 10 min to eat but waited a 70 min to get to get all of the food. It was barely packed. The appetizers were dry. Tasted like it was under a heat lamp for awhile. The only reason it wasn't 1 star was the service was ok.

There's a reason this place has so few stars! Came here for a work lunch with 8 coworkers to celebrate a new hire. The service was incredibly slow- it took over an hour to get our sandwiches after we ordered and the place wasn't even busy! The menus were falling apart and my chair had a leg that was 4 inches shorter than the other 3. 4 inches!! That's quite a difference to not notice! I almost fell off when I sat down. The food was just ok. Nothing was particularly good. We'll stick with the China Inn place next door from here on out.
Food was good, and the service was fast. Our server Krista was the best!!(: really friendly service.
Came for happy hour. Great service.  Sliders were good. Drinks good. Prices good. But the hot fudge sundae was just Hershey's syrup...not a bit of hot fudge to be tasted. Boo!

If I could rate below 1 star, I truly would. So my fiance and I ordered from the endless appetizer menu. 15 minutes later the wings and mozzarella sticks came and to disbelief came  out cold not once but twice. I even saw some people get up and leave the resturant either because they were taking to long to be served or the food was simply not up to par. I WILL NEVER EAT HERE AGAIN, NOR WOULD I RECOMMEND TO MY WORST ENEMY. Yes!!! Service and food was that damn bad.
If you need help going to the bathroom this is the place for you. Endless appetizers means an endless nigh of multiple trips to the toilet to express yourself. Enjoy

Good late night dinner experience, and food didn't take long. There is a big  menu to choose from. Our favorite part was the 2 for $20 option and the huge section of drinks. My girlsfriends favorite midnight snack was the mac n cheese. Place is kinda of hidden but makes it easier to get seated right away.
Went there over the weekend and tried the steak and lobster meal and it was really good. The only downfall was that the side dishes were small portioned.

Food was okay not really the issue though my chicken was over cooked. Yet the ambience and staff was really a weird issue. The greeters look like Wednesday Addams, and the servers looked like they all came from a Neckromantix concert(psychobilly band) in all black and zombie like makeup and slick hair. I was hoping for a fun night out and enjoying some drinks and dinner but I spent most of the time weirded out and looking around. The restaurant looked run down and even my menu was falling apart. It was a haunted house of a place. The entire wait staff just seem to be hanging out. Our server and few others seem to be really active and hustling but most of the staff was just standing around talking. There's just so many nicer restaurant options nearby and especially for a Saturday night that it's better to choose else where then here for drinks or dinner.

Let me just say that if you are more concerned about what servers are wearing and the shade of their makeup than the food and ambiance, you should not step into a TGIF in the first place. If you're worrried about the servers' eyeshadow, there's other places for that. This is Fridays, where the drinks are stiff, servers are friendly, and the food is good. Not great, but it beats cooking over a hot stove, especially since it's been so hot recently. I'm a fan. Katie is an amazing server. Overall, we were very happy with our service and we can't wait to go back!
I got the endless appetizers and the came out luke warm and the potato skins were horrible but the waitress was super sweet

I always have an awsome time at TGI FRIDAYS weather its the bar or dining area. My favorite locations are Centre Lake Dr in Ontario, Corona, and Rancho Cucamonga by Victoria Gardens. I basically live there lol Staff is always on point and lets talk about the food. Cajun shrimp pasta is delicious thats my usual. My husband always gets rib eye steak and lobster. Endless apps for only $12 and happy hour on sundays all day! ultimate margaritas are the best.

I use to work here and prefer to go to this one than the mall. I must say that Jeff was a better manager but I'm sure things will run smoother at some point. I did notice that the portions of the food are smaller which is disappointing because the price is the same.
The food here is above average compared to other Fridays but the main reason we come here is Chris the bartender is awesome!! Friendly and good service!!

Came here before going to an Ontario Reign hockey game (not my choice) but was still apprehensive thanks to the mostly brutal reviews. To my surprise, it was actually a good experience. When I came in, it wasn't terribly crowded so I was able to seated quickly before the rest of the party arrived. I then ordered a beer. I was surprised to find that Friday's doesn't have very many options for craft beer. Lagunitas IPA was the closest they had (Lagunitas is no longer considered a craft beer because they are 50% owned by Heineken but that's a technicality I guess. Lol) so that was a bit disappointing. Once the rest of the party got there our orders were taken and food & drinks were served quickly. Our waitress was the only one in our section but she was more than up to the task. I ordered the California Club and it was really tasty. Stacked high with meat & the bread was moist. I'd dee get this again. Everyone else was very satisfied so overall it was a win. This is kind of a strange location for a restaurant (it's kind of out of the way in an industrial park) so it's not a spot I'd frequent but I'm pleased with my experience there.
Love it here great happy hour 7 days a week and all day Sunday friendly staff with ratchet customers, I love it

I went in to this with low expectations, it's a TGI Friday but all I wanted was a little dinner and some drinks.  My expectations clearly weren't low enough. Pecan crusted chicken salad; Is there dressing on there?  I have no idea. The chicken was completely tasteless and as dry as death valley. sinking lower... New England Clam Chowder; AKA - onion soup.  I'm pretty sure everything in the white paste mixture was onion.   Even the big chunks that you figure will end up being potato, nope more onion. The bartender was polite and attentive.  So there's the 1 star.

Service like mentioned by the others not up to par. I think they try to memorize your whole order and end up making 50 trips for something you have to repeat yourself over and over and by the time they bring it your food is cold. (creamer for your coffee and sides of dressing) Food was ok. Just be ready to repeat yourself over and over and not feel bad about it.

Best experience I've had at any restaurant in a while. I've been to this location before and it's been okay, but today it was great.   We went here to celebrate my birthday and our waiter Luis was Great. I'll keep this short, Luis was the sh#t! He did everything he could to provide great service, from continously feel drinks, bring condiments needed, took our appetizer order over and over, and just basically took care of us and made us feel like we were his priority.. I kind of observed how he was at other tables and seen that he was just as good as he was to us as he was to all his other tables.   If management reads this, I'd like them to know they have a very good employee. & also want to say when we left the restaurant everybody from my dad, son and I left talking about how great the service that Luis provided us was.. Thanks Luis!!
Martini's suck...you pay for two ounce and there is probably less thn  an ounce in the drink. Watery shit..... don't order!
Fish was terrible! Waited 35 minutes to get food and the Maui was burnt. Service was great but the food was terrible. Not coming back.

Came to have a dinner with the family tonight and had 5 star service from Cesar! He was very attentive and went above and beyond on making our dinner awesome all the way till the end when he even held the door for us.

This Fridays sucks . Its dead as hell yet their services always slow! servers are dry. they charge for sauce?? wtf. Plus Fridays took off their 2 for 20. now your paying full prices for bad services and meh food! no thank you.

Bad service, my son had the flu an wanted a good meal after being sick....it took them 1 hr to get our food to us, the waiter was slow, he took 30 min just to get us our appetizer, ill never go there again.

I would not even give this place one star if I could. This was the longest I ever waited in my life to be seated. There was plenty of open seats and they still made us wait. Then when we finally got seated it took another 40min just to get our food. You would think the food would have at least taste good. Well think again it was horrible. We got there at 7 and left at 9. That is how long it took to get seated get food and wait for a check. I would never go back to this location again. I've been to way more packed and busy restaurants and never has such a worst experience with such bad tasting food. NOTE: to anyone reading do not go to this location.

Gross!! That's about all I can say about this place. Fire the Chef or whoever made the recipe cause this was some of the nastiest food ever. I actually felt it in my stomach all night, woke up and puked it up.  The service was descent, and they did give us a discount because of the nasty food but really no excuse for a resteraunt of this type. To pin point the grossness,  the potato wedges were the nastiest thing i have ever eaten. Seriously!!! This was my first time eating at this place and it will for sure be my last.

We got there at 4:30 to let them know we had a party of 18 and would like to be seated by 6 if possible, we did not sit down at the table until 6:55, we did not get drinks until 7:35 and we did not get our food until 8:04. I couldn't not believe how horrible the ball was dropped in the kitchen, the server had a great attitude go.

I arrived for dinner this evening just to have a bad experience. My server did not actively listen to my order. I asked for drums and received all flats. I asked for buffalo sauce and received jack daniels sauce. I ordered a shrimp and chicken Cajun pasta with extra chicken. I received the pasta with 2 shrimps and less chicken than I normally receive. As a frequent guest, this service was far beneath good. The server may have been new but could not handle the volume although it was slow. When I contacted the manager to provide my feedback, I was immediately interrupted and was not able to provide my account of the incident. I was informed that the manager would call me back however it's about an hour later and no call. To add to my dissatisfaction, my friend asked me to place a order for him in hopes it would be ready since his commute was approximately 45 mins to the restaurant. Upon his arrival, he was informed that the order was not placed and it would be additional wait time.  The manager said the order was placed in correctly by me however my friend was on the phone when I placed the order. The audacity of the manager to tell my friend that I placed the order wrong. In an effort to rectify the lack of responsiveness , she informed my friend that he can half price for the mistake. After his articulation of his dissatisfaction, the Manger then considered to take care of the order. At the end of the day, there were layers of service issues including the responsiveness from the manager. I'm not coming back.

Horrible service!! They were not crowded.  We went out for drinks at another spot before coming to TGIF because we were hungry. We ordered at the bar: drinks & a french dip. Bartender Chris never checked on us after we first ordered. After 50 minutes of waiting we told him just to cancel the French Dip and asked for our check. He didn't explain or  apologize for why it was took so long. When he brought the check he gave us a "free appetizer" card for our troubles. We left it with our receipt because we won't be going back. The other bartender was pissed at a waitress for a wine mix up was cussing about it before he punched the wall.

This seriously was just ok. We were a bit of a large group. Roughly 18 of us. Decent location and friendly servers, but unfortunately either had to much on her mind or really couldn't handle a large crowd. Got more than three peoples orders wrong. Never came back to check on refills. We had to call her back over to our table several times to ask for what we needed. So yeah ... Other than that, parking was deent and bathrooms were clean ...
It's a Tuesday and takes 20 mins for your entree to come and 10 fucken mins for your beer to come . Ain't no one hear !  Place is Wack

Where do I start? Ate lunch there today. Terrible slow service. Cold burger, horrid fries. Filthy women's restroom. Dining area very dirty.  Why were we asked if everyone in our party was over 21 before seating us in an area near the bar, only to have them seat a family with very loud toddlers next to us 10 minutes later? Never going back!

We do not recommend you dine at this TGIF restaurant...we ordered Dragonfire Chicken on the lunch special and the broccoli stems had mold. We let our server know and showed him the broccoli and he then took it to the kitchen manager. Kitchen manager came out to apologize and dismissed our complaint excusing that all broccoli stems have  black dots in the stems and that mold grows outside the broccoli  flowerettes, i explained mold geows from inside  out......

Bartender got my drink wrong twice!!! I ordered appetizers and didn't get them til 45 mins to an hour after I ordered them. The sad part I dined by myself and still the order was too much for them to handle. Smh. I love Fridays this place just a dump.

I work in the guest service industry, so writing the review means a lot. I am currently sitting inside, at our table at the moment. Before I write anything, understand that the food was just "okay". It may have been satisfying considering how hungry we were, that's besides the fact. Not just mine, but the company I came with as well. Overcooked and lukewarm. Service? Very slow and seemed as if our party was unimportant and not a priority. Other guests in the restaurant seemed very irritable and aggregated, as well. Employees were standing around and not being attentive. I would give an opinion for our server, but she never gave us her name. Anyway, she was okay - not great, however. There were no silverware until other guests at another table acknowledged it.  Anyway, that's all I will say. Hope this place gets it together.
Waited for our lunch for 29 min. My team and I were very disappointed. Poor service and couldn't get my meal right. No avocado means no avocado.

We came back after 7 months in hopes things would be better. Sadly, nothing has changed. The food is still not served hot and service was extremely slow this time. Avoid this location at all cost. Drive the extra 10 minutes to Victoria Gardens which seems to have better reviews.

This is by far the worst TGIF! 15 mins before we even saw the waitress. It wasn't even busy. We ending getting the AYCE apps and they were awful. The apps were cold and had no flavor and a little on the greasy side. The mix drinks were no correct. They were over powering. Something you don't expect when its a simple mix drink. I'm not a fan. I don't think I will be returning any time soon.

I'm really disappointed in this location. After being seated, we browsed the menu for a while but noticed nobody seemed to be remotely interested in taking our orders. Not even a bus boy came to offer us water at least. We waited an additional 10 minutes and saw two other parties be seated on either side of us and receive service right away. We pushed the "call server" button on the table kiosk and the red light flashed vigorously as ALL of the servers just walked laps around our table. Talk about annoying, especially when you're starving and there's no reason to be ignored. We ended up leaving without even being noticed bc that's how unimportant we were to this establishment. Needless to say, I won't ever come back and they've put a bad taste in my mouth about Friday's in general. If you're looking for good service and a worthwhile dining experience...RUN!!!!
DO NOT COME HERE! I had my college graduation today and this was the only place to come to..,apparently 1.5 hours is not long enough to make a hamburger.
food comes out good, but it is not worth the wait. ignoring our table and not checking up will definitely get you a bad review... step up your service here.

TGIF Ontario  This one has been here awhile but is well run.   Today I experienced some of the best service I have ever received at any restaurant, including TGIF's.   The waitress's were on it and helping each other out. The kind of service I hope to receive.  Food was great too!  I got the lunch special. For what you get, a good value.

I went to this tgif and my server "Luis" was the WORST. He ignored my group while the restaurant wasn't busy. We saw him chatting and hanging with other servers. He made my experience here very bad, if I could put zero stars I would. My girlfriend was very upset by the time we paid. Did not leave a tip. Will not be coming to this location again.

It's really hard to give any Fridays more than 3 stars because of the food.  I had the All American Stacked burger, presentation was pretty much fridays style, however the  ONION-BACON JAM made the entire burger, nom nom...and the fries were good and crispy. Typical beer list doesn't seem to change but with the seasons. So I can always rely on a refreshing pint of Stella And Chris, way to be the champ and pull the morning shift. Team player lol....and thanks for making sure my glass wasn't empty....3 STARS FOR CHRIS

The manager contacted us and we got a gift certificate for the former service. When we went back, everyone gave us great customer service and we have been going back on a regular, sounds like they really care and took care of the problem

I know it's not surprising to give Friday's a bad review, but the only reason I came this night was to redeem a coupon I had bought from a youth organization in the community.  Came here on a Sunday night around 7:00. Ordered a draft beer, a well drink, French onion soup, pot stickers, 2 Cobb salads. Waiter was Sean.  First problem was no silverware, no waters. Ordered our drinks and he didn't remember I asked for lemon. Had to ask again.  The apps were fine but the waitress who brought them did not bring small plates or napkins or the silverware we never had. Sean was nowhere to be found. The girl took off.  Waited forever for the Cobb salads. Sean was gone for most of the time. In fact, he was gone most of our visit. He noticed at one point that we had been waiting for the Salads for a long time and said he'd go check on them.  When he brought the salads, they had no blue cheese crumbles. Wanted to alert him of this. He was gone. Even used the "call server" button on the little ziosk thing. Gave up and ate them anyway. Waited forever for him to return with the check. He even commented that he noticed we had been waiting "for a few minutes". He smelled like cigarettes this time. Guess he had a break.  He was nice enough but just not attentive enough. Wouldn't go back.

The service was fair but it took a really long time to get our order. I could understand if they were busy but they weren't. I realize that my friends and I are no longer the target demographic, but I would expect it to take less than the 40 minutes it took for our order to get to our table. We didn't have a large order and we didn't make any changes to the items other than no egg on my salad. The salad was just eh, it wasn't bad but it wasn't outstanding either. I probably won't be returning to this location and I would rethink visiting any other locations in the future. Also the bathroom was disgusting!

My cousins and I met for dinner here last night. What a mistake! It took an hour to get our 3 meals, iced tea came out after the meal. Food was cold, fish sandwich was missing the balsamic glaze, macaroni and cheese was forgotten. When macaroni was brought it was just thrown together, not even toasted, white soft bread crumbs on top. Gross! Chicken was like cardboard, the list goes on....... Service was horrible and the restaurant wasn't even busy. I will not return to this place ever again! Horrible all the way around! And the restrooms were filthy with no toilet paper in all but one stall.
Sat night at tgif was fun. Drinks were good pur server was awesome, Jen thank you. She was attentive as well as fun.

Our server forgot drink orders and utensils. We ordered an appetizer plate and the mozzarella sticks snapped in half - They should be warm and gooey! My wife ordered a bar drink and it came with so little alcohol in it she ordered an extra shot. The restaurant apparently has a policy where you can't have a shot until you finish your first drink. We've been here before late at night and sat at the bar where we had great service and decent food. Our experience in the dining room was dismal.

I come here for the drinks (Bloody Mary) and the appetizers. I love the pepper jalapeño hot wings the best ever!!! As well as the spinach dip, and the Bloody Mary. I really do not order meals because they have screwed up my orders more then once. I also have notice the later you go the better the food is. When I come in at two the food is not good in my opinion. If I show up at six in the other hand food is awesome. The costumer service can get better but over all it's a good restaurant.

On our way home from L.A.X stopped at this location. I haven't had TGI Fridays in years. Must say it was good. We were there about 2:45 so the restaurant was empty.(thank heavens we missed the lunch rush) it took a minute for us to be seated. This would be my only negative from our lunch. They had no one at the  door to fret you.  My mom had the planked smoked ahi and I had the jack Daniels chicken sandwich. Excellent choices. My mom couldn't stop saying mmmmm. It was so good she used the plank to make sure she got all the last bit of fish and rice. My chicken sandwich was delicious. How can you go wrong with a Jack Daniels sauce.  Our server Alexa was very attentive and super quick. She checked on us frequently even though my mother gave her a hard time about the table kiosk, and asked way to many questions. Sorry Alexa. All I all great place for a quick informal lunch/dinner. Glad we decided to eat here.

Food was excellent and service was exceptional.  Server, host and management team are very courteous and professional. Manager went out of his way to mail me home a pair of sunglasses I left there and live too far to come back. Will return to this location when in the area

First of all no one to meet you at the door. Second the service horrible. You see people moving around but no one is going to the tables like they need to be.  They are all having a good time in the kitchen. At first I thought it was just me but, several groups came after us and no one to greet them.  Food was late kept asking for one more plate setting finally had to reach over to another table. Just order the burger because everything else is pretty bland and small don't be fool by the photos Mc n Cheese bad after taste after the $105. Bill best thing leaving. Sorry TGI

We came to TGIFRIDAYS for my brother's 30th family birthday dinner. We were a party of 11. We waited for 40 minutes to be seated, which was expected because there are no reservations allowed. We waited 23 for a waitress to come to our table and take our drink order, which was not ok...and this was after I had to go ask the host if we had been assigned a server. Then it took us an additional 15 more minutes to get those drinks. But none of the kids got theirs until we got our food. The ribs were terrible and the clam chowder was terrible...but we couldn't eat until we got utensils, which came 10 minutes after our food did. Forget about refills. Then we waited and waited...and waited for the tab. I won't come here again.

Had the Dragonfire Chicken which I really enjoyed. My husband had the Bruschetta Chicken Pasts and loved it. We shared the Tennessee Whiskey Cake. It was worth the splurge! The service was fantastic. Will definitely return.

They suck as a costumer service plus they asked for ID and they dont  take consular ids even when u look older i mean come on plus it says identification but anyways they suck and dumb never coming back again

Only thing good about this place were their alcoholic beverages and late night happy hour specials.  The prices were cheap, however, the food quality was less than mediocre.  What do you expect when you are going in late night?  I guess not much. Johnny was our server and he was great until the ending of the experience.  It was around 1am and he told us that they were doing last call for drinks and food.... when they closed at 2am.  Interesting.  I've never been to a place that does last call that early.

I hated it here, flat out. Service was terrible, including the manager. Just nonstop back talk & sass. We only ordered unlimited appetizers, and it took a solid 30 minutes. Don't come here, it sucks lmaob
Same old corporate garbage. It doesn't suprise me that Americans think this is real food.

First and last ever coming here  Had a date night with my hubby last Thursday night  As we walked in to the restaurant there was no host at the front , minding you there were customers sitting down waiting to be seat , after 10mins went by I walked up to a server and ask do we just sit our selves . She said no that she'll seat us , to wait another 5-10mins ugh . This restaurant was so empty I don't see how they were busy or couldn't assist us . They only had 2 servers working that night  . The server even said " we weren't prepared for this big rush" ... wow!!! What rush?! lol I mean why hire workers that don't know how to do there job , anyways After we got seated we waited about 20mins to even get our drinks , after ordering our food something very simple . It took our server 45'mins to get us our food ! Smh ... the only good thing was my food that I ordered but my hubby food was cold smh .. before I left I had to use the restroom and oh my this restroom was disgusting!! This location should shut down , its sad to see that the yelp reviews is actually true about this restaurant .

Here's a thought - change your hours.  I walk in at 12:20 and was told they did last call at 12:15. Why? No drinks, no food, but the doors open. Super disappointed in the effort. Customer service is not paramount, clearly.

The worst clam chowder soup I've ever had.  The Caesar salad was almost as bad....limp.....  maybe should have stuck with bar food.  Looking around at nearby plates I can't say I'll come back to this chain.   McDonalds is looking good now!

Seriously people why come here. I was there because I had a gift card but I wished I had thrown it away. The service was ok just slow. The food was bland and the restaurant felt dirty and the bathroom waa gross.
